executeBatch.!doc:
execute a batch processing for the number of threads and the batch sizes.
The processItemCallback is the only callback that will be called with an argument: the single work item to process.
executeBatch.!type: fn(items: [?], processItemCallback: fn(?), threadCount: number, batchSize: number)

executeBatch1.!doc:
execute a batch processing for the number of threads and the batch sizes.
The processItemCallback is the only callback that will be called with an argument: the single work item to process.
executeBatch1.!type: fn(workProviderCallback: fn(), processItemCallback: fn(?), threadCount: number, batchSize: number)
